PC Number: 2002-2105

Date: 2002-12-06

(T.B. Rec. 830188)











Whereas the Piikani Nation is a band as defined in the Indian Act;



Whereas the Piikani Nation, beginning in 1990, has submitted nine specific claims and filed litigation with respect to wrong doings by the federal and provincial governments;



Whereas Canada, the Province of Alberta and the Piikani Nation have agreed to enter into a settlement agreement to settle all nine specific claims and litigation matters;



Whereas in accordance with the Ratification Voting Guidelines set out in the Piikani Nation / Alberta / Canada out-of-court settlement agreement on September 16 to 18, 2002, a ratification vote was held to consider the out-of-court settlement agreement and a majority of the eligible voters of the Piikani Nation approved the settlement agreement and authorized the Council of the Piikani Nation to enter into the settlement agreement on behalf of the Piikani Nation;



Whereas the settlement agreement was executed by the authorized Council in accordance with the agreed upon thresholds;



Whereas the Alberta Cabinet considered the settlement agreement on November 15, 2002 for approval and assented to the settlement agreement;



Whereas the settlement agreement was executed by the appropriate Ministers of the Alberta Government;







.../2

- 2 -



Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Indian Affairs and Northern Development and the Treasury Board, hereby authorizes the Minister of Indian Affairs and Northern Development to execute the Piikani Nation / Alberta / Canada settlement agreement, copy of which is attached hereto as Schedule "A", on behalf of Her Majesty in right of Canada.
